--- layout: risc_en topic: Cache shortText: Behavior of Cache (Mano) ---
A computer system has memory of size words and cache memory of size memory words. Each word has width of bits. The cache is -way set associative. The block size is one and the replacement policy is LRU. Each row (from left to right) contains the following fields: valid, tag, value. The following memory access list is given, from left to right:
The cache is empty before the above access list is attempted.
  1. How many times was there a hit?
  2. How many replacements were there in the cache?
  3. What is the width of one cache line?
  4. What is the most common value fo the TAG fields after the access list was attempted?
  5. How many valid bits are zero at the end of attempting the above access list?
